title: Using the Combination Formula
text: The combination formula is used to calculate the number of ways to choose $$r$$ objects from a set of $$n$$ objects, where the order of selection does not matter.

hintAnswer: Expand 7! and cancel out the common 6! term in the numerator and denominator
title: Simplification
text: Expand the formula to make it easier to solve. How can you simplify solving 7!/(6!*1!)?
choices: Expand 7! and cancel out the common 6! term in the numerator and denominator
Simplify 7! and 6! into smaller numbers, then subtract the results
Use the distributive property to break 7!, 6!, and 1! into separate terms
